present.english: I wait for the late bus

The angry customers wait for the slow service

The angry customers were waiting for the slow service

The patient child will wait for the busy mother
The angry customers will wait for the slow service

The patient child waited for the busy mother
The angry customers waited for the slow service

optative.english: I should wait for the late bus
